title: Wellington Country Park Walking Route

images.title: Brendan and Ruth McCartney / Riseley
images.caption: Riseley. The main entrance to Wellington Country Park off the B3349.

images.title: Brendan and Ruth McCartney / Riseley
images.caption: Looking north towards Riseley Mill, on the River Whitewater. Riseley Mill on the River Whitewater: 4 storeys; brick with slate roof; mill race silted up; bed-stones still in place. All other machinery has gone. This square is a mixture of farmland and Wellington Country Park.

images.title: Car park at Wellington Country Park by don cload, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: The good sized car park at the site.

images.title: The lake at Wellington Country Park by don cload, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: The lake at Wellington Country Park

description: This 350 acre park is very popular with walkers with four splendid nature trails to follow. One trail even allows you to get up close to the resident herds of Red and Fallow deer. There is also a 35 acre lake with picnic and BBQ areas, an Animal Farm with a Petting Barn, Miniature Golf and a Miniature Railway. The park is located a few miles south of Reading. You could extend your walk in the nearby Bramshill Forest and visit the RSPB's Hazeley Heath where wildlife such as red kites and deer can be seen.
